title: What time is the FA Cup draw? TV channel and live stream details
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest football stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The remaining 79 clubs in the FA Cup are ready to find out their fate in the first round of the competition.

Thirty two non-league clubs progressed from the fourth round qualifying will now be joined by 47 sides from League One and Two.

Ipswich Town go into the pot as the highest ranked team in the Cup and face the possibility of being drawn against eighth tier Maldon and Tiptree or Chichester City.

Manchester City are the holders of the FA Cup having thrashed Watford 6-0 earlier in 2019 - with Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus grabbing braces to secure City’s domestic treble.

The last team drawn out will receive a bye into the second round following Bury’s expulsion from the EFL.

(Image: Getty Images)

When is the draw?

The draw will take place at 7.10pm on Monday 21st October.

Where can I watch the draw?

The draw will be on BBC Two.

Will there be a live stream?

If you have a BBC account you will be able to watch live on BBC iPlayer .

Alternatively you can follow the draw with Mirror Football's live blog.

(Image: FA.com)

Who is making the draw?

Karen Carney and Jermaine Beckford.

When will the first round ties take place?

The first round ties will be played across the 8th and 9th November.
description: Thirty two non-league clubs are in the hat after progressing through qualifying
